The Ramanujan

Â£420

Height: 24.5"

Diameter: 13"

Wood: Djalla

Weight: kg

Skin: Medium goat skin

Finish: Skin Twist

The red Djalla wood and elegant profile and carving of this djembe provide a distinct and pleasing Islamic aesthetic. Named for the influential Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan who helped develop prime number theory, examples of prime number arithmetic can be found in the carving of this djembe. The tall bowl shape and Djalla wood combination make for a drum with exceptionally sweet tones and very dry slaps.
